verses.text: Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto me, Though \w Moses|strong="H4872"\w* and \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w* \w stood|strong="H5975"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* me, \add yet\add* my \w mind|strong="H5315"\w* \add could\add* not \add be\add* toward this \w people|strong="H5971"\w*: cast \add them\add* \w out|strong="H7971"\w* of my \w sight|strong="H6440"\w*, and let them go \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*.

And it shall come to pass, if they \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto thee, Whither shall we go \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*? then thou shalt \w tell|strong="H0559"\w* them, Thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Such as \add are\add* for \w death|strong="H4194"\w*, to \w death|strong="H4194"\w*; and such as \add are\add* for the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*, to the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*; and such as \add are\add* for the \w famine|strong="H7458"\w*, to the \w famine|strong="H7458"\w*; and such as \add are\add* for the \w captivity|strong="H7628"\w*, to the \w captivity|strong="H7628"\w*.

And I will \w appoint|strong="H6485"\w* over them \w four|strong="H0702"\w* \w kinds|strong="H4940"\w*, \w saith|strong="H5002"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* to \w slay|strong="H2026"\w*, and the \w dogs|strong="H3611"\w* to \w tear|strong="H5498"\w*, and the \w fowls|strong="H5775"\w* of the \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w*, and the \w beasts|strong="H0929"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*, to \w devour|strong="H0398"\w* and \w destroy|strong="H7843"\w*.\f + \fr 15.3 \ft kinds: Heb. families\f*

And I will \w cause|strong="H5414"\w* them to be \w removed|strong="H2189"\w* into all \w kingdoms|strong="H4467"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*, \w because|strong="H1558"\w* of \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, for \add that\add* which he \w did|strong="H6213"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.\f + \fr 15.4 \ft cause…: Heb. give them for a removing\f*

For who shall have \w pity|strong="H2550"\w* upon thee, O \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*? or who shall \w bemoan|strong="H5110"\w* thee? or who shall go \w aside|strong="H5493"\w* to \w ask|strong="H7592"\w* how thou \w doest|strong="H7965"\w*?\f + \fr 15.5 \ft how…: Heb. of thy peace?\f*

Thou hast \w forsaken|strong="H5203"\w* me, \w saith|strong="H5002"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou art \w gone|strong="H3212"\w* \w backward|strong="H0268"\w*: therefore will I stretch \w out|strong="H5186"\w* my \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* against thee, and \w destroy|strong="H7843"\w* thee; I am \w weary|strong="H3811"\w* with \w repenting|strong="H5162"\w*.

And I will \w fan|strong="H2219"\w* them with a \w fan|strong="H4214"\w* in the \w gates|strong="H8179"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*; I will \w bereave|strong="H7921"\w* \add them\add* of children, I will \w destroy|strong="H0006"\w* my \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, \add since\add* they \w return|strong="H7725"\w* not from their \w ways|strong="H1870"\w*.\f + \fr 15.7 \ft children: or, whatsoever is dear\f*

Their \w widows|strong="H0490"\w* are \w increased|strong="H6105"\w* to me above the \w sand|strong="H2344"\w* of the \w seas|strong="H3220"\w*: I have \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* upon them against the \w mother|strong="H0517"\w* of the young \w men|strong="H0970"\w* a \w spoiler|strong="H7703"\w* at \w noonday|strong="H6672"\w*: I have caused \add him\add* to \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* upon it \w suddenly|strong="H6597"\w*, and \w terrors|strong="H0928"\w* upon the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.\f + \fr 15.8 \ft the mother…: or, the mother city a young man spoiling, etc, or, the mother and the young men\f*

She that hath \w borne|strong="H3205"\w* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w languisheth|strong="H0535"\w*: she hath given \w up|strong="H5301"\w* the \w ghost|strong="H5315"\w*; her \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* is \w gone|strong="H0935"\w* down while \add it was\add* yet \w day|strong="H3119"\w*: she hath been \w ashamed|strong="H0954"\w* and \w confounded|strong="H2659"\w*: and the \w residue|strong="H7611"\w* of them will I \w deliver|strong="H5414"\w* to the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* their \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*, \w saith|strong="H5002"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

¶ \w Woe|strong="H0188"\w* is me, my \w mother|strong="H0517"\w*, that thou hast \w borne|strong="H3205"\w* me a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* of \w strife|strong="H7379"\w* and a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* of \w contention|strong="H4066"\w* to the whole \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*! I have neither lent on \w usury|strong="H5383"\w*, nor men have lent to me on \w usury|strong="H5383"\w*; \add yet\add* every one of them doth \w curse|strong="H7043"\w* me.

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Verily|strong="H3808"\w* it shall be \w well|strong="H2896"\w* with thy \w remnant|strong="H8281"\w*; \w verily|strong="H0518"\w* I will cause the \w enemy|strong="H0341"\w* to \w entreat|strong="H6293"\w* thee \add well\add* in the \w time|strong="H6256"\w* of \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* and in the \w time|strong="H6256"\w* of \w affliction|strong="H6869"\w*.\f + \fr 15.11 \ft cause…: or, intreat the enemy for thee\f*
Shall \w iron|strong="H1270"\w* \w break|strong="H7489"\w* the \w northern|strong="H6828"\w* \w iron|strong="H1270"\w* and the \w steel|strong="H5178"\w*?

Thy \w substance|strong="H2428"\w* and thy \w treasures|strong="H0214"\w* will I \w give|strong="H5414"\w* to the \w spoil|strong="H0957"\w* without \w price|strong="H4242"\w*, and \add that\add* for all thy \w sins|strong="H2403"\w*, even in all thy \w borders|strong="H1366"\w*.

And I will make \add thee\add* to \w pass|strong="H5674"\w* with thine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w* into a \w land|strong="H0776"\w* \add which\add* thou \w knowest|strong="H3045"\w* not: for a \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* is \w kindled|strong="H6919"\w* in mine \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*, \add which\add* shall \w burn|strong="H3344"\w* upon you.

¶ O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou \w knowest|strong="H3045"\w*: \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* me, and \w visit|strong="H6485"\w* me, and \w revenge|strong="H5358"\w* me of my \w persecutors|strong="H7291"\w*; take me not \w away|strong="H3947"\w* in thy \w longsuffering|strong="H0639"\w*: \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that for thy sake I have \w suffered|strong="H5375"\w* \w rebuke|strong="H2781"\w*.

Thy \w words|strong="H1697"\w* were \w found|strong="H4672"\w*, and I did \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* them; and thy \w word|strong="H1697"\w* was unto me the \w joy|strong="H8342"\w* and \w rejoicing|strong="H8057"\w* of mine \w heart|strong="H3824"\w*: for I am \w called|strong="H7121"\w* by thy \w name|strong="H8034"\w*, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w God|strong="H0430"\w* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w*.\f + \fr 15.16 \ft I am…: Heb. thy name is called upon me\f*

I \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* not in the \w assembly|strong="H5475"\w* of the \w mockers|strong="H7832"\w*, nor \w rejoiced|strong="H5937"\w*; I \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* \w alone|strong="H0910"\w* \w because|strong="H6440"\w* of thy \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*: for thou hast \w filled|strong="H4390"\w* me with \w indignation|strong="H2195"\w*.

Why is my \w pain|strong="H3511"\w* \w perpetual|strong="H5331"\w*, and my \w wound|strong="H4347"\w* \w incurable|strong="H0605"\w*, \add which\add* \w refuseth|strong="H3985"\w* to be \w healed|strong="H7495"\w*? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a \w liar|strong="H0391"\w*, \add and as\add* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* \add that\add* \w fail|strong="H0539"\w*?\f + \fr 15.18 \ft fail: Heb. be not sure?\f*

¶ Therefore thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, If thou \w return|strong="H7725"\w*, then will I bring thee \w again|strong="H7725"\w*, \add and\add* thou shalt \w stand|strong="H5975"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* me: and if thou take \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* the \w precious|strong="H3368"\w* from the \w vile|strong="H2151"\w*, thou shalt be as my \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*: let them \w return|strong="H7725"\w* unto thee; but \w return|strong="H7725"\w* not thou unto them.

And I will \w make|strong="H5414"\w* thee unto this \w people|strong="H5971"\w* a \w fenced|strong="H1219"\w* \w brasen|strong="H5178"\w* \w wall|strong="H2346"\w*: and they shall \w fight|strong="H3898"\w* against thee, but they shall not \w prevail|strong="H3201"\w* against thee: for I \add am\add* with thee to \w save|strong="H3467"\w* thee and to \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* thee, \w saith|strong="H5002"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And I will \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* thee out of the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w wicked|strong="H7451"\w*, and I will \w redeem|strong="H6299"\w* thee out of the \w hand|strong="H3709"\w* of the \w terrible|strong="H6184"\w*.
